newsitem.title: MEXICO: Invermexico to finalize Latinvest sale.
newsitem.headline: Invermexico to finalize Latinvest sale.

text.p: Mexican financial group Grupo Financiero Invermexico may finalize the sale of its 66 percent stake in the New York-based brokerage house Latinvest to Banco Bilbao Vizcaya this week, a group spokesman told Reuters.
"At the end of this week, or next week at the latest, the final sales contract will be signed between the four parties involved," said Inaki de Abiega, from the international area at Invermexico.
"The sales formula will be determined by (Latinvest's) share capital on September 30, when the deal is to be settled. The amount will vary between 100 and 105 million pesos," he added.

At the beginning of August, the owners of Latinvest -- Invermexico, Brazilian bank Banco Bozano Simonsen and the board of Latinvest -- signed a letter of intent to sell 100 percent of the shares in the brokerage to Spanish bank Banco Bilbao Vizcaya.
"The effects of the transaction (on Invermexico) will be on accounts only. The 66 percent stake (held by Invermexico's brokerage) is equivalent to 97 million pesos," de Abiega added.
Although the amount involved in the transaction is not considered substantial, it constitutes part of Invermexico's effort to capitalize its main subsidiary, Banco Mexicano.
At the end of June, Banco Mexicano's capitalization index stood at 9.12 percent, or slightly above the required minimum of eight percent.
-- Maria Luisa Aguilar, Mexico City newsroom +525 728-9553
